entry.title: Revert "Add unit tests to base::mac::LaunchApplication."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1aa162790d33be44d74997d40a541f3325ee5511.



Reason for revert: Failing on Mac ASan: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac%20ASan%2064%20Tests%20(1)/84854/overview



Original change's description:

> Add unit tests to base::mac::LaunchApplication.

>

> Before adding more functionality to this method to support some PWA

> notification use cases, this CL adds the framework for testing this

> method as well as implements some tests for most of the existing

> functionality.

>

> In order for the added tests to not be flaky, this also moves a

> workaround for a bug in the underlying OS APIs is from web-app

> usage of this method to LaunchApplication itself. On macOS 11 and 12,

> sometimes the launch API claims the launch failed despite actually

> having a successful launch. This is detected by scanning the

> running applications for one matching the launch attempt.

>

> Bug: 938661

> Change-Id: I820a7e86a5e8ac7ed13e823a3aee9f00f54b2ebb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4721447

> Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

> Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

entry.title: Revert "Enable the consistently passing tests in AXTreeTest"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 90e873889cd12fdebff23f6555217565468714f8.



Reason for revert: Failes on Linux MSan https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/42151/overview



Original change's description:

> Enable the consistently passing tests in AXTreeTest

>

> This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

> tests across the entire chromium.

> If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

> the change.

> If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

> them.

>

>

> ------ How the change is created ------

>

> I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

> disabled tests on reviver builders

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

> aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

> consistently passing.

>

> Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

> are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

> explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

> enable them on certain platforms.

> But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

> ones suggested by `git cl format`.

>

>

> ------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------

>

> You may choose a platform you are interested,

> e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

> [link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

> In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

> chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

> there will be a luci run link.

> [ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]

>

>

> ------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------

>

> The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

> *consistently* passing on the relevant builders.

>

> ui/accessibility:accessibility_unittests/AXTreeTest.BogusAXTree

> 146 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

> 178 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

> 192 fuchsia-x64-rel

> 110 linux-lacros-tester-rel

>

> data version: 2023-06-28 16:45:51

>

> Bug: 1380293, 1359080

entry.title: Refactor RenderWidgetHost observation in BootTimesRecorder.
entry.content:
(This builds on the original CL by dandrader@:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4373698,

which was reverted.)



Some upcoming changes in //content for swapping RenderFrameHosts

(https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4656206)

are triggering various test failures due to a `DCHECK(rwh)` in

BootTimesRecorder. It turns out that the RenderWidgetHost observation

logic in BootTimesRecorder needs an overhaul, since it doesn't

currently support navigations that swap RenderFrameHosts (and hence

RenderWidgetHosts). This can be an issue even for same-site

navigations, and while we were a little lucky to not run into it

before for OOBE, it will soon become a problem with projects like

RenderDocument and the use of early commit optimization for navigation

transitions.



This CL overhauls that logic to support RFH/RWH swaps. Since it needs

BootTimesRecorder to be aware of WebContentsObserver events (in

particular, RenderFrameHostChanged), it builds on CL:4373698 which

added that support, and also fixes the issues that caused it to be

reverted. (The unmodified original CL is in PS1.)



Specifically, two issues that broke login metrics in that CL were:



1. Once the new tab helper was attached, DidStartLoading events

immediately caused all RenderWidgetHosts to start being

observed. Previously, RenderWidgetHosts started to be observed only

after going through BootTimesRecorder::RecordLoginAttempted()

(presumably when the login process has started). Hence, RWHs could

start getting observed for login events before the login actually

started, causing metrics to be logged too early.



This CL fixes this by setting a login_started_ flag in

RecordLoginAttempted() (similarly to the old have_registered_ flag)

and only starting to observe RWHs if that flag has been set.



2. With notification service, all widgets from all WebContents were

monitored for events, but CL:4373698 changed this to monitor just the

WebContents that loaded the OOBE page. However, this is insufficient

because OOBE uses the tag for login, and tags load

in a separate inner WebContents. So that refactor also missed all RWH

events for tags where the actual login happened. This CL

fixes this by monitoring

WebContentsObserver::InnerWebContentsCreated() and creating a new

instance of BootTimesRecorderTabHelper for any new inner WebContents

(when created for tags).



This CL also does some other cleanup along the way, such as retrieving

RenderWidgetHost through RenderFrameHost, instead of

RenderWidgetHostView, which allows removing various unnecessary null

checks. A WebContents will always have a non-null current

RenderFrameHost (GetPrimaryMainFrame()), and that RFH will always have

a non-null RenderWidgetHost.



Change-Id: I72f9bc79ee3aedf6f305bea838f578152bc4bdae

Bug: 1467011, 1174762, 1174764

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4706588

Reviewed-by: Alexander Alekseev

Commit-Queue: Alex Moshchuk

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Reviewed-by: Xiyuan Xia

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178735}

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Fix a dangling pointer in UkmObserver
entry.content:
On the one hand, UkmObserver holds a raw pointer reference to

UKMRecorderImpl (ukm_recorder_); on the other hand, UkmDatabaseClient

, the parent class of UkmObserver, is a static singleton. These two

setups jointly lead to the fact that the raw pointer ukm_recorder_ is

never properly released.



This CL fixes this issue by explicitly setting UkmObserver to null in

UkmDatabaseClient when its lifecycle should end, so that we can

trigger the destruction process.



Bug: 1462061

entry.title: Do not log `DATA_LOSS` if upload was rate limited.
entry.content:
When an upload job is rate limited and rejected, return `OUT_OF_RANGE`

error (`RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED` is already returned when there is not enough

memory). Then when logging the outcome, do not log this error and

`NOT_FOUND` error (as before).



For that purpose, callback is changed to not just provide optional

but full StatusOr with the reported error.



A new test have been added to cover this case, and other tests have been

modified: it appears that failures they were expected to get were

actually caused by rate-limiting; now that has been changed, and tests

truly verify the expected conditions.



In addition, dm_server_uploader is simplified using `BindPostTask`.



Tested manually on VM - no DATA_LOSS logged in the chrome log anymore.



Bug: b:290591820

entry.title: [webauthn] Refactor cable pairings
entry.content:
Chrome maintains two lists of paired phones for a webauthn request: one

on cablev2::Discovery and another on AuthenticatorRequestDialogModel.

This CL updates Chrome to maintain a single list on

AuthenticatorRequestDialogModel instead. Callbacks taking indices are

replaced by callbacks taking Pairing objects instead.



This will make passing cable pairing data to Windows easier (see

follow-up).

entry.title: Add test coverage for MimeHandlerView subframes
entry.content:
Create an iframe in the MimeHandler test extension's index.html page,

which will trigger creating a subframe under the MimeHandlerGuestView.



In https://crbug.com/1469262, a change to a navigation throttle caused

a crash whenever a non-PDF MIME Handler extension was used (such as

QuickOffice). The test coverage added in this CL would have caught the

crash. The current test coverage does not create a subframe in the

guest frame, which was what was needed to reach the necessary codepath

from the navigation throttle.

entry.title: Fix several issues with menu metrics and layout.
entry.content:
* Updating the empty menu items/metrics did not invalidate layout. This

could lead to flaky effects like empty menus showing up blank when

opened a second time.

* Menu items drew "new" badges immediately after the title, but reserved

space for them in the minor text region. This could lead to overlap

for items with both.

* Menu dimensions did not reserve space for the minor icon, leading to

potential overlap.

* Menu dimensions did not reserve space in the minor text region for

submenu arrows when !MenuConfig::reserve_dedicated_arrow_column,

leading to potential overlap.



This also attempts to reorder MenuItemView::CalculateDimensions() a bit

for clarity.



Bug: 1457972

entry.title: Robolectric: Prevent multiple sandboxes per shard
entry.content:
The previous grouping logic grouped by SDK, but it turns out we also

need to group by looper mode and list of instrumented classes.



This changes the test runner to:

1) Have --list-tests write results to a .json file

2) Use a .json file to tell each shard what tests to run



I at first had the tests grouped by instrumented classes, but this

led to >150 groups for chrome_junit_tests and the runtime increase

from ~8 minutes to ~14 minutes on the CQ.



Instead, we now use the union of all instrumented classes and apply

it to all tests so as to not increase the number of groups too much.



We also use the results of test listing (the .json file) to skip

classpath scanning for test classes when actually running the tests

(which speeds up shards)



The net effect of this is that chrome_junit_tests goes from 8-9

minutes on android-nougat-x86-rel to 4-5 minutes.



Bug: 1465376

entry.title: [ ChromeRefresh2023 ] Fix subpixel rendering for avatar/update buttons
entry.content:
Fixes an issue where the Update app button (top right next to app menu)

would render incorrectly on high resolution monitors. This happens

because there was previously no background set (opaque). This means when

it comes time to render we may see a "smear" effect on the text due to

subpixels painting themselves the same color as the text. Which would normally be covered up by a background.



Note: Subpixel rendering bugs seem to only affect Windows operating systems.

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix leveldb coding fuzzer failure. [try 2]
entry.content:
Updated the wrong fuzzer last time (encode instead of decode).

Don't try to re-encode when decoding fails as that's non-sensical

input. The correct fuzzer for verifying non-sensical input to the

encode function is indexed_db_leveldb_coding_encodeidbkey_fuzzer

entry.title: Reland "Move ReadAloudPlaybackHooks and related interfaces to public dir"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 237c449875db854ad3a1f7a777e117e304edb468



Clank change 6253631 removes a dependency on //chrome/android/modules/readaloud/internal:java that was breaking things. That one should land first and then this CL can land.



Original change's description:

> Move ReadAloudPlaybackHooks and related interfaces to public dir

>

> Context for this change: we're putting playback-related code for Read Aloud in a preinstalled isolated split that only loads when a page needs to play. I learned that the build config for the split needs to live in //clank so I'll set that up in another CL, but the plan is to have the new "public" dir contain all the interfaces we need to call into the playback split from the outside.

>

> My next //clank CL will add the real implementation of ReadAloudPlaybackHooksProvider, and then we'll be ready to link it all into the build.

>

entry.title: [no-vary-search-hint] Add plumbing to wait for multiple prefetches
entry.content:
We would like to be able to wait for more than just one matching

in-flight prefetch.



This CL adds plumbing to keep track of multiple prefetches to be waited

on. The new NavigationHandleUserData class PrefetchMatchResolver will

store all of the prefetches the current navigation is blocked waiting

on headers.



In this CL we will continue to wait only for one matching in-flight

prefetch.



There will be CL(s) built on top of this to wait for multiple in-flight

prefetches.



Bug: 1462206

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in AXTreeTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



ui/accessibility:accessibility_unittests/AXTreeTest.BogusAXTree

146 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

178 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel



data version: 2023-06-28 16:45:51



Bug: 1380293, 1359080

Change-Id: I1d0964c7ecd279202d6f4048e983b5d3222c3eca

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4739603

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

entry.title: views: remove DanglingUntriaged from ViewHierarchyChangedDetails
entry.content:
This change:

1. Marks the parent and move_view raw_ptrs in

ViewHierarchyChangedDetails as never dangling. In practice objects

of this type never dangle, since (outside of tests) they are only

created in View::AddChildViewAtImpl() and don't escape that function.

2. Makes all members of that type const, and deletes the 0-arg

constructor for it;

3. Reworks some of the views unittests to not depend on assignment of

ViewHierarchyChangedDetails, and simplifies some of their logic by

using absl::optional.

4. Rewrites the ViewHierarchyChanged unit test into several smaller

tests, each of which sets up a view tree, does one operation to it,

and checks for the generated notifications. The previous test,

which reused the same view tree for several cases, was too hard for

me to understand or debug.

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in Quic
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.

entry.title: [SBv5] Introduce SafeBrowsingApiHandler
entry.content:
Introduce SafeBrowsingApiHandler interface that will be extended to

handle URL check through GMSCore Safe Browsing API. This interface

will eventually handle hash database and hash real-time URL checks on

Clank and WebView.



The setup of the new handler is simpler than the SafetyNetApiHandler

because it doesn't require the client to call init() beforehand. The

handler becomes usable as soon as it is injected into

SafeBrowsingApiBridge.



Some notable TODOs:

* The new function StartHashRealTimeUrlCheck added in

SafeBrowsingApiHandlerBridge is currently not called in production

code. It will be connected from SafeBrowsingUrlCheckerImpl to do

hash real-time check in a follow-up CL.

* Only the threatType returned from the interface is consumed. Other

fields will be consumed in a follow-up CL before returning the

final threatType.

* In the future, we will add a version check and fall back to hash

database check if GMSCore doesn't have the required version.

entry.title: shortcuts: Update button visibility
entry.content:
* addButton shouldn't be hidden when user is editing shortcut,

clicking the addButton will automatically cancel the editing-row

and add a new row for editing.

* restoreButton only depends on if the existing shortcuts are the

default shortcuts or not. It has no dependency on the edit mode.



* Add a GetDefaultAcceleratorsForId mojo api to get the

default accelerators for a given actionId, the accelerators

received and are the same as what user see in the frontend at the

default state.

* If current accelerators are not the same as default, the restore

button will be shown.

entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/4655611 introduced a lot of difficult to

read #if BUILDFLAG(ENABLE_TAGGED_PDF) clauses. This CL removes

enable_tagged_pdf GN build flag and associated #ifs hoping that

this won't affect mobile binary size too much.

method Page.printToPDF and expect it to work consistently.

entry.title: [Panorama][GM3] Show extracted color in custom color selector
entry.content:
* In GM3, instead of showing the main color (the main color of the

background image/extracted color) as its own swatch, place the color

in the custom color picker.

* Prefill the color input with the currently selected custom color to

help make reselection of the last color easier if the user swaps to

a different color within the same session. That way the user reopens

the custom color input and it already has the color it was before

prefilled.

* Created a helped function in color_utils to go from SkColor to Hex

Color to prefill the color input with, since it can not take in RGB.

entry.title: mac: use ULMO (LZMA) compression for installer disk images
entry.content:
ULMO (LZMA)-compressed disk images can only be used on macOS 10.15 and

later. As Chrome on macOS now has a macOS 10.15 minimum requirement (bug

1405325), it's reasonable to use this compression type.



ULMO (LZMA) replaces UDBZ (bzip2) compression.

GoogleChrome-115.0.5790.114.dmg (current stable) experienced a reduction

from 214.5MB to 175.3MB (-39.2MB, -18.3%) with this change.



A portion of the size reduction is attributable to the use of a

nonstandard (large) UDIF chunk size when using the ULMO format

(0b00241b2d05, https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/4738531).



LZMA-compressed disk images (.dmg) are near the size of, but not quite

as small as, LZMA-compressed installer packages (.pkg) containing the

same content. The comparable .pkg for 115.0.5790.114 is 168.3MB.

Installer package compression is not chunked in the same way that disk

image compression is, which allows a better overall compression ratio at

the expense of precluding efficient random access. Random access is not

very valuable for installer packages, but is very valuable for general

filesystem access.



Bug: 1130557

Change-Id: I75a44f462990107265538cf6ff452bea8aced5a7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4741795

entry.title: Clean up handling of incomplete relations
entry.content:
An incomplete relation is one where the target id is not yet on a

connected node in the DOM. In these cases, the source node often must

be serialized without the relation information. It's important to

reserialize the source of the relation with the corrected relation data once the relation target is known.

entry.title: Add unit tests to base::mac::LaunchApplication.
entry.content:
Before adding more functionality to this method to support some PWA

notification use cases, this CL adds the framework for testing this

method as well as implements some tests for most of the existing

functionality.



In order for the added tests to not be flaky, this also moves a

workaround for a bug in the underlying OS APIs is from web-app

usage of this method to LaunchApplication itself. On macOS 11 and 12,

sometimes the launch API claims the launch failed despite actually

having a successful launch. This is detected by scanning the

running applications for one matching the launch attempt.



Bug: 938661

Change-Id: I820a7e86a5e8ac7ed13e823a3aee9f00f54b2ebb
